description:
Tree pruning of TPO trees

Tree Preservation Application At:

85 Highbury Park, Islington, London, N5 1UD

TPO Reference:

T1 – Tulip Tree of LBI TPO (No.384) 2007
T5– Norway Maple of LBI TPO (No.384) 2007
T8– London Plane of LBI TPO (No.384) 2007
T25– Whitebeam of LBI TPO (No.384) 2007
T30– Cherry of LBI TPO (No.384) 2007
T31– Leyland Cypress of LBI TPO (No.384) 2007
T33– Norway Maple of LBI TPO (No.384) 2007
T27– Norway Maple of LBI TPO (No.384) 2007
T47– Sycamore of LBI TPO (No.384) 2007
PO Number:

T100456

Work specifications:

T1 – Tulip Tree of LBI TPO (No.384) 2007, Lift crown to 2.5 m from ground level.
T5– Norway Maple of LBI TPO (No.384) 2007, Lift crown to 4 m from ground level.
T8– London Plane of LBI TPO (No.384) 2007, reduce back low branch to the North by 1.5 from branch tip.
T25– Whitebeam of LBI TPO (No.384) 2007, lift crown to 3 m from ground level, reduce crown by 1 m.
T30– Cherry of LBI TPO (No.384) 2007, cut back crown over highway by 1 m.
T31– Leyland Cypress of LBI TPO (No.384) 2007, fell.
T33– Norway Maple of LBI TPO (No.384) 2007, lift crown to 4.5 m from ground level over carriageway.
T27– Norway Maple of LBI TPO (No.384) 2007, lift crown to 4.5 from ground level over carriageway.
T47– Sycamore of LBI TPO (No.384) 2007, lift crown to 3 m from ground level.
decision_conditions: The council expects to see a replacement tree planted in a location close to the Leyland Cypress that is to be removed, but further from the boundary wall to prevent damage in the future. The species is to be agreed with the Tree Preservation Officer prior to planting, the size is to be no smaller than 30-35 cm DBH (Semi mature). Replacement tree is be planted within one planting season.
